page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The Looe Area is in South East Cornwall.The coast and countryside are very attractive.In Spring,the roadsides and woods are full of primroses,bluebells and campion.The coast is rocky with sandy coves.The farms are mostly under grass for grazing or hay,but corn and potatoes are also grown.There are many holiday caravans,camp sites,hotels and guest houses.Looe itself lies on a tidal estuary which divides it in two,with a bridge between. The area contains some historic buildings,including Looe's Old Guildhall,Trelawne Manor,St.Nicholas's and Talland churches,and there is the site of a Celtic Monastery near Hannafore.
